Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Carotid and IVC Ultrasound Measurements for Predicting Postinduction Hypotension in Older Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: This prospective observational study included 102 older adults scheduled for elective gastrointestinal surgery

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria were age 65-75 years, ASA physical status II-III, and BMI 15-30 kg/m².

Intervention.evidence: This study aimed to compare the predictive effects of carotid and inferior vena cava (IVC) ultrasound measurements on PIH.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare the predictive effects of carotid and inferior vena cava (IVC) ultrasound measurements on PIH.

Method_Outcome.evidence: PIH was defined as a >30% decrease in systolic blood pressure (SBP) or SBP <90 mm Hg within 15 minutes post-induction.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This prospective observational study included 102 older adults scheduled for elective gastrointestinal surgery, conducted from January to June 2022.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The area under the receiver operating characteristics curve (AUROC) for FTc(W), FTc(B), and ΔVpeak were 0.815, 0.691, and 0.713, respectively.
